column1: Maintain the Patency of Ductus Arteriosus
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
JustCurious, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: A couple comments.  Ric9 was stressing the need to insert the needle at a 45 degree angle and to rub the area for 5 minutes to avoid bruising.  No disrespect, but I've not found either to be the case.  I go straight in (perpendicular to the skin)and rub the area for maybe 30 seconds--I've had minor bruising once, and have used the product successfully many dozens of times. I have also been inclined to go with the underside of the penis, maybe 1/4 to 1/2 inch off midline. As they say, watch out for veins.  I, like some others, don't like the injector system they provide--just too cumbersome.  I get small insulin syringes (with, I believe, 26 gauge needles) at the clinic I work at, and they have worked well for me.  The whole syringe holds only 0.5 ml (= 0.5 cc) and is calibrated to giving down to 0.01 ml.  Giving even as little as 1-2 mcg is easy with these.  (I'm currently taking more like 25-35 mcg, with good results.) The needles themselves are 1/2 inch long, and I insert it (biting down on the cap as I do so!) all the way in. Also, I don't know how expensive the Caverject is (haven't tried it), but the Edex seems to be effective, readily available, and reasonably priced. I, like others, draw off what I need and refrigerate the rest for later. (It seems to start gradually losing potency after a couple of weeks.) If you do this, be sure to use aseptic technique: I keep the vial in a clean plastic baggie, and, in addition to wiping the skin with an alcohol swab, I wipe the rubber portion of the vial before inserting the needle.   With multiple uses per vial, I find this system to be much less expensive than Viagra (and, for me, much more effective).

column2: Loverboy, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I went to a urologist to get treatment. he wrote script. went to drug store to pick up.  Dr. requested return visit to show how to use drug.  Showed how to set up injection and actually gave .25 of 1.0 ml.  He stated to watch erection to discern whether I needed a higher dose.  Left office to go to work, walked around with an erection for 2 hours.  Dr. stated that I could adjust between .25 and .50 dose.  He stated any medicine left in injector was supposed to be disposed of.  Off the record, he said to cap it, put in fridge and use within 3 days.  Went today, to V.A., to get same meds. Upon talking to V.A. Dr., who did not offer much information, he informed me to inject entire 20 mcg's.  He's crazy.  My new wife and I are extremely satisfied with Edex.

Thanks in advance

column2: shemNvic, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My husband and I used it for the first time last night. This only after pills, (which had side effects) pumps (which did not work) and creams (well...waste of time and money.  We used it (a bit skeptical) my husband hates needles. He's diabetic and after 15 min of using the entire 20cmg dose; it was like 25 all over again.  It was great. But...then he got spooked because after almost 4 house it had not completely gone down and he was ready to go to ER.  I examined and found it was going down and not at the rock hard erection from the beginning.  after about 30 more minutes it was back down but he complained of some moderate pain.  Perhaps next time we will use 1/2 of dosage to see what result we get with that.  How long can we keep the remaining dose in frig 3 to 5 days?  Hate to lose the meds.  All in all a satifying experience with a new med.

column2: Peachpit, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was a little nerveous about putting needle into penis..!!! Doctor set me up with Autoject ..You set mechanism,drop needle in,apply against side of penis.push button..it does the rest.You dont SEE or FEEL the needle AT ALL..Amazing!(especially for a needle phobic like me)..Unit has safety mechanism almost like nail gun,needs to be pressed against to fire..Drug works fantastic..I'm still working with Doctor to find optimum dosage..First few erections lasted nearly 2 hours after climax..He said take cold pill /that helped but I think dosage needs to come down a bit..Drug is expensive without prescription plan( with plan about 5-6$ a shot..not bad..I was surprised at the no nerve sensation on side of penis..5-10 minutes and I was in business...It's the way to go

column2: Ric9, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: While incredibly expensive and the Caverjet injector can be extremely inaccurate, it works extremely well and I'm a paraplegic.  Because I need about 4mcg and no injector provides that and you can actually get 10cmg when you dial 5, I bought diabetic fine needles and waste the injector by filling the needles and fridge them.  I was trained in a trial using the drug in a vial so I can use needles fine.As to pain and bruising, you have to be very careful that you go in about 45 degrees to the top of the penis and it is incredibly important to hold and rub the injection site for a full five minutes.  Doing that and bruising does not occur and the pain that can occur disappears.  I did hit a nerve once and was in agony for a week.The dosage can be quite dangerous.  I started on 10cmg and that caused an eight hour erection.  That is not a good thing.I've complained to Pfizer about the injector sometimes delivering zero dose and sometimes double the dose but they just ignored the complaint.  It seems to be a problem with how the selector works and only happens in some batches.

column2: Richlo, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Tried all pills..nothing workd..frustrated..knowing that Im a diabetic I never blamed myself - since its not my fault Im one...Juvenile diabetes..so I cautiously tried them all..and I was getting frustrated till tears were coming..Then visited a urologist instead of an internal med doctor..He suggested to try edex since most of his diabetic patient love it..The PA tried 10MCG of the 20..and I was rock hard within about 1/2hour for about 1 1/2 hours..One of the urologist there works with Edex and said that to use 1/2 of my 20MCG..fridge the rest..and reuse the remaining in days..sure enough 3 days later..I tried it and BAM..I had an erection in less than 5 minutes...even faster than the 1st dose I took..LOVE IT!! Those who can find EDEX..as for TRIMIX with your Urologist - its the same thing and they will get a compounding pharmacist and provide needles and swab..cheaper to I hear..SO its not the MEDICINE that is hard to get..its the PRODUCT combo of EDEX...My girlfriend was so supportive - and now she is enjoying it as well...be smart - its not our fault guys..We are just not perfect..Im only 38 and in prettygood shape but this is the tragedy from Diabetes for a long time..

column2: JustCurious, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I didn't really want to describe my experience with the medication, other than to say that I have used it once and it worked well.  However, like the reviewer who commented that it "hurt like h---" I must agree.  My doctor started me on 20 mcg which, in retrospect, seems like a high dosage to be starting at.  I am intrigued with the idea of using much smaller doses (a few mcg, up to maybe 5) as did that gentleman.  Does anybody have any good information as to the stability of alprostadil in the fridge?  I too would be inclined to pitch it within a few weeks, a month at most.  I also wonder if anyone has combined, say, Levitra (20 mg 'almost' works for me) with very low (1-3 mcg) of alprostadil injectable?  I ask because, while the 20 mcg lasted 2-3 hours for me, I wonder if 1-3 mcg would be much more short-lived in effect, such that the Levitra would help carry the day.  (The idea of only, say, 15-20 minutes of sexual activity---if using only the low dose of alprostadil injectible--- is not all that appealing to me.)  I realize priapism is a potential problem here---I would 'experiment' cautiously with such combos.  But I just wondered if anybody else out there had tried such an approach.

column2: Dan, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was a combat medic for 17 yrs and due to exposure to agent orange in Vietnam found that I was having problems with getting erect as the years progressed.  A doctor at the VA told me about the medication and said that most men don't want to use it because of the delivery method.  I have found that if you are familir with giving injections it is very easy to use.  Since I have been using the med I am more confident around women and can have an erection that lasts longer than it did prior to the medication.  The needle is small and possibly flimsy but if you are careful it causes no more of a problem than most needles that are for injection.  Since starting alprostadil I have gotten maried and my wife thinks it is great.Most of the women I was with before my wife said they would never give the injection because they didn't want to hurt me but giving it myself has proved to be the best way to inject it.

column9: I have been a registered nurse for 33 years and could not figure out how to combine the medication in the plunger! The risk of injury is not worth the savings from this generic product.

column2: harryone, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I became completely impotent after cryosurgery for prostate cancer. None of the pills worked and vacuum devices were  only marginally successful.  First experiences  with caverject produced great erections  but also  hurt like H---.  Eventually  I reduced  dosages to about 1(one) microgram by  drawing about 5% of the contents of a 20 MG hypo into a  small hypo commonly used by diabetics. These cost  only a few cents each and have  a very small needle.  This  method  eliminates the dull pain which occurred with dosages of 5 MG or more and I get several  doses per  hypo. My Dr.  suggests that  I keep  the mixed hypo in the refrigerator and  discard any mixed alprostadil  after one month and be very careful not to contaminate the stored  medicine. I have been using this method 2 or 3 times a week  for nearly one year with absolutely no problems and nothing but smiles  all around.
